title: Search Engines - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers May 30, 2019 Is Google's Redesign Good for Ads or Brands? Search Engines At the end of last week, Google announced a major design change for mobile search results. Does this latest change do too much to blend ads and organic results? Read this post By: Roger MozBot May 27, 2019 Analyzing Google's Desktop "People Also Search For" Box Search Engines | Marketing Industry | SEO Analytics We’ll take you through how the PASF has changed over the years and how you can take advantage of everything it has to offer. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers May 22, 2019 Podcasts in SERPs: Is Audio SEO the Next Frontier? Search Engines | Advanced SEO At I/O 2019, Google announced that podcasts would soon be coming to organic SERPs. We know they've been able to transcribe audio for a while. What's next for audio SEO and how can we prepare for it? Read this post By: Roger MozBot May 15, 2019 How to Explore a SERP Feature Strategy with STAT Search Engines | Advanced SEO | Keyword Research With SERP features are taking over, here’s how you can uncover the ones that’ll work for you. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers May 14, 2019 How Often Does Google Update Its Algorithm? Search Engines In 2018, Google reported an incredible 3,234 improvements to search. That's more than 8 times the number of updates they reported in 2009 and an average of almost 9 per day. Read this post By: Miriam Ellis May 7, 2019 I Want to Rank Beyond My Location: A Guide to How This Works Local SEO | Search Engines We’ll break rankings down into five easy-to-grasp groups, and make sense out of how Google appears to bucket rankings for different types of users and queries. Read this post By: Justin Champion May 6, 2019 Creating Quality Content in 2019 (For Search Engines and People) Content Marketing | Search Engines | SEO Copywriting Learn how to solve for searcher intent to create successful, quality content that makes people (and Google) happy. Read this post By: Lily Ray April 22, 2019 We Surveyed 1,400 Searchers About Google - Here's What We Learned Search Engines | Marketing Psychology | Marketing Industry We surveyed 1,400 respondents to better understand how they search. Here's what we learned. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers April 11, 2019 How Bad Was Google's Deindexing Bug? Search Engines | Advanced SEO On Friday, April 5, Google confirmed a bug that was causing pages to be deindexed. Our analysis suggests that roughly 4% of stable URLs fell out of page-1 rankings on April 5, and that deindexing impacted a wide variety of websites. Read this post By: Miriam Ellis April 8, 2019 How to Find Your True Local Competitors Local SEO | Search Engines | Competitive Research Who are your clients’ true competitors if every SERP is a local SERP these days? We'll help you answer that question. Read this post By: Paola-Didone March 26, 2019 The 5 SEO Recommendations That Matter in the End SEO Basics | Search Engines | On-page SEO SEO is an ever-changing game. Here are 5 things that I consider to be evergreen SEO recommendations. Read this post By: Miriam Ellis March 19, 2019 5 Google Business Profile Tweaks To Improve Foot Traffic Local SEO | Search Engines | Branding Leverage these 5 Google Business Profile tips to increase your client's foot traffic. Read this post By: Tom Capper March 13, 2019 5 Reasons Legacy Brands Struggle With SEO (and What to Do About Them) Branding | Search Engines | Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Why well-known brands run into SEO difficulties and 5 recommended tactics to help remedy them. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers March 4, 2019 March 1st Google Update: The Mysterious Case of the 19-Result SERPs Search Engines | Advanced SEO On February 28th and March 1st, we saw unusually high rankings flux. Digging into the data, we captured hundreds of SERPs with more than 10 page-one organic results, with some having as many as 19. These appeared to be similar to In-depth Articles, but they disappeared the next day. Read this post
